strong.span: Click here for help and tutorial videos!

span.title: Article Title: Board of Education Meeting April 30

span.div: The Board of Education will hold its regular meeting on April 30, 2020 at 8:00 p.m. remotely by videoconference and/or telephone conference and the public will not be permitted to attend the meeting in-person. The public will be able to view and/or listen to the meeting by viewing the simulcast (Link will be posted here). The public may submit comments prior to and/or during the meeting by sending an email to [email protected]

h3.a: Meal Delivery by Bus Restarts on April 27

span.div: We are happy to announce Grab & Go bus delivery will begin again on Monday, April 27 beginning at 10 a.m. Please view the bus routes link as there were some changes. These differ from the bus stops used by our children during the school year. To approximate the time you should be waiting at the bus stop, please account for approximately three minutes at each stop. You can estimate your stop by multiplying the number by 3. Example, if you are stop #10, then your bus should arrive at approximately 10:30 am; if you are stop #20, then your bus should arrive at 11 am, etc. Please also give some leeway on each side of the estimate as this is not an exact science. Please note that Friday bus delivery may take a little longer as weekend meals will be included. Please click the title for all the information!

The buses and/or vans will deliver Monday through Friday mornings. Grab & Go meal pick up will continue at Commack High School’s main entrance loop this week and going forward. If you have not previously signed up for bus delivery and would like to have meals for children under the age of 18 delivered by bus, please send an email to [email protected]. Please include your last name, the number of children you need meals for, the bus, and your email address and phone number should we need to reach you. If you have already signed up, you’re all set, and don’t need to do anything further! Click here for the bus routes.

h3.a: Two Commack High School Students are ISEF Finalists!

div.span: Two of our Commack High School science research students, Jordan W. and Ethan S., are finalists in the International Science and Engineering Fair (ISEF), sponsored by Regeneron (formerly INTEL). Finalists were chosen regionally in this year’s virtual fair, and our student’s projects were among more than 450 submissions rated and analyzed by the judges. Our two finalists were among only 15 chosen in all of New York State. Click the title to read more!

span.title: Article Title: New! Online Parent Workshop

div.span: We hope that you and your family are well. As we continue this journey together, we would like to ensure that we are meeting the needs of our families. Commack School District is committed to keeping our students/families connected to their teachers and school as well as keep learning alive! As a result, the District is in the process of creating a series of parent workshops. Please click here to enjoy the first workshop. For your convenience, you may easily view this workshop at any time. Thank you for taking the time to join us!

span.title: Article Title: Universal Pre-Kindergarten Program and Application (UPK)

a.span: Please click here for the UPK Application

p.span: , to be completed by May 1, 2020. Eligibility requirements are listed on the application. Only one application per child please. Students will be selected by a lottery system, and notification will be made after the lottery is held.

span.title: Article Title: Helpful & Instructional Resources for Students and Parents

h3.span: Helpful & Instructional Resources for Students and Parents

div.span: We have created a new page with helpful resources for the Community that includes additional instructional resources for students in Grades K-12, MITA, Grab and Go lunch info, government resources, Regents Exam information, Parent Workshops, and help for families to access while our schools are closed.

a.span: Please click here to access the information!

h3.a: Student Q&A with the Superintendent, Mrs. Boritz & Mr. Hartman

div.span: As we continue to navigate this unprecedented time, we recognize that there are many emerging questions. As a result, our Commack High School Legislative Advocacy Students gathered questions from members of the student body. Please click the title above for a list of questions and a link to the webcast.

span.title: Article Title: Student Access to Internet

div.span: The Commack School District assumes parents/guardians agree to permit their children access to the Internet and participation in recorded, live-streamed and/or interactive lessons. If this is not the case, parents or guardians must email their children’s school principals.

div.br:
By Mail: P.O. Box 150, Commack, NY 11725
By Phone: (631) 912-2000
By Email: [email protected]
Directions to Commack Schools

div.span: The Commack School District Mission Statement
div.br:
Within the context of a caring community of learners, our primary mission is to provide an exemplary
learning experience that will allow each child to acquire the necessary knowledge, skills, attitudes, and
values to become a successful, contributing member within our school community and greater society.
